hero.heading: Patio Doors Checklist
hero.copy: A patio door is your family’s gateway to outdoor celebrations and relaxation. Let us help you find the right one, so you can start celebrating and relaxing sooner.
hero.direction: How to shop for patio doors

cards.title: Start with the basics.
cards.copy: Not sure where to begin? By the end of this guide you should be able to walk into a store with an idea of what you want.

cards.title: Make your own checklist.
cards.copy: As you’re learning about patio doors, use our checklist to keep track of things you’d like to discuss with a Lowe’s sales associate.

cards.title: When you’re ready, talk to us.
cards.copy: We’ve got patio door experts ready to help you in our store. We can give you an installation quote while you’re there.

inspiration.heading: Consider Going Pro
copy: Skip the hassle of needing to accurately measure your patio door and frame.
You don’t have to worry about accidentally voiding your warranty.
A pro will clean up the mess and dispose of your old patio door.

outro.heading: If you go DIY, here’s how to measure your patio door.

cards.title: Width
cards.copy: Measure distance between the side door jambs at three points: the top, middle and bottom of the patio door opening.

cards.title: Height
cards.copy: Next, measure the distance between the top of the head jamb to the top of the bottom sill at three points: far left, center, and far right.

cards.title: Depth
cards.copy: Measure the width of the jamb, from edge to edge, across the existing door frame. Ignore any door trim.

next.heading: Learn about our different types of patio doors.
next.copy: When you’re thinking about your patio door type, consider the amount of sunlight and open space you have now versus the amount you’d like to have.
